results.title: Paper plates to silver spoons: the complete guide to table manners
results.brief_description: Designed as a quick guide to table manners, this American production will amuse and inform. Table manners, utensil use, correct posture and table settings are discussed for both formal and informal dining situations. Cultural differences in table manners are also discussed. After watching this, viewers will be able to handle any dining situation with confidence as well as learning when it is acceptable to put elbows on the table and eat with one’s fingers!

results.title: Desert Conquest
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: The story of how the Australian Mutual Provident Society, by a scheme of mass clearing and scientific development transformed over a quarter of a million acres of desert land in South Australia into rich pasture holdings. Shows how the land was cleared and how the men and their families who worked on this project eventually settled on the reclaimed soil on farms of their own.

results.title: Desert cargo
results.creator_credit: A Vickers, Leslie Sansom, British Information Services and Vickers Films
results.brief_description: For the transportation of liquefied natural gas from Algeria to Britain the engineers of Vickers shipbuilding undertake at the Barrow Shipyard the building of a highly specialised tanker. The initial research, construction and testing that led up to the launching of the “Methane Princess” are set against the background of the scheme to bring a new source of energy to Britain and pioneer a new world industry

results.title: Descent
results.creator_credit: Giles Walker, Paul Cowan, Desmond Dew, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Descent is a film about David Murray, a member of Canada’s National Ski Team. It shows the less glamorous aspects of training for the World Cup Downhill race, the tension prior to the event, and Murray’s mixed feelings when it is all over. The camera records a spectacular slow-motion fall, and speeds that would not appeal to your average highway patrol. Murray comes across as a skillful, courageous and dedicated athlete, and a very likeable guy at that. Sound film without commentary. Film without words.

results.title: Pandora
results.creator_credit: Derek May, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Experimental filmmaker Derek May and colour cameraman Martin Duckworth collaberated here in a surrealistic retelling of the old myth. A film of technical experiment with forceful, colourful effect and creative use of shadows.

results.title: Panasonic VHS-C Movie Camera NV-A1
results.brief_description: The Panasonic VHS-C Movie Camera NV-A1 was a condensed VHS (Video Home System) videocassette format, which was mainly used in consumer-grade camcorders. It was a smaller size than VHS, as with Betamax, but could be played in a standard VCR with an adaptor.
results.description: Various magnetic tape technologies were produced during the period of the videotape format wars during the late 1970s and early 80s, which was particularly significant for the amateur filmmaker market. Cameras became more and more compact, making them cheaper and portable. The Panasonic VHS-C Movie Camera NV-A1 was a condensed VHS (Video Home System) videocassette format, which was mainly used in consumer-grade camcorders. It was a smaller size than VHS, as with Betamax, but could be played in a standard VCR with an adaptor making the footage easier to access than ever before.
description_for_label: Various magnetic tape technologies were produced during the period of the videotape format wars during the late 1970s and early 80s, which was particularly significant for the amateur filmmaker market. The Panasonic VHS-C Movie Camera NV-A1 was a condensed VHS (Video Home System) videocassette format, which was mainly used in consumer-grade camcorders. It was a smaller size than VHS, as with Betamax, but could be played in a standard VCR with an adaptor making the footage easier to access than ever before.

results.title: Democracy in action: citizen's welfare, citizen's job
results.creator_credit: H Schiller, O.E. Kress and Ifage Filmproduktion (DE)
results.brief_description: A close look at the manifold tasks of the elected shire and town councillors in Germany. We see them at meetings, seeking progress and prosperity for their citizens. By encouraging and helping establish new local industries on a community basis, there is resultant increase in population, housing, hospitals, and amenities. Such progress is soundly based and assured.
results.title_for_label: Democracy in action: citizen’s welfare, citizen’s job
results.creator_credit_for_label: H Schiller, O.E. Kress and Ifage Filmproduktion (DE)

results.title: Der Freischutz
results.creator_credit: Hartmut Schottler, Achim Freyer, National Video Corporation, Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen
results.brief_description: Carl Maria von Weber’s opera “Der Freischutz” with libretto by Friedrich Kind first premiered in Berlin in 1821. This production by Achim Freyer was performed in Stuttgart by the Wurttemberg State Opera Chorus and Orchestra, with Ulrich Eistert as Chorus master and musical direction by Dennis Russell Davies. Romantic, melodramatic, evil and mystical, this German folkloric tale set in the Bohemian forest tells of a rivalry between Max (Toni Kramer) and Kaspar (Wolfgang Probst) over the hand of the beautiful young Agathe (Catarina Ligendza), daughter of Kuno (Fritz Linke) the head Ranger to Prince Ottokar. For Max to be worthy of marrying Agathe, he has to win the traditional shooting contest on his wedding morning. Kaspar has already sold his soul to the devil - will Max do the same? Using colorful set designs, costumes and make-up, this stage performance has a Grimm’s fairytale quality, albeit an adult fairytale. Cast also includes Wolfgang Schone and Raili Viljakainen. Sung in German with no English subtitles. Includes booklet with English translation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hartmut Schottler, Achim Freyer, National Video Corporation, Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen

results.title: Democracy a la Maude
results.creator_credit: Patricia Kearns, Annette Clarke, Signe Johansson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Profiles social critic and outspoken head of Canada’s largest citizens rights group, the Council of Canadians, Maude Barlow. Through interviews with family members and Barlow herself, we hear how her fighting spirit emerged from an early age, her introduction to feminism in the 1970s as a young mother, and her involvement in women’s affairs, including areas such as media pornography, equality and reform for the living conditions of women prisoners. Most noticeably, Barlow spearheaded the Council of Canadian’s court challenge against the Competition Bureau and Hollinger Inc after the Canadian government supported media magnate Conrad Black’s takeover of Southam Newspapers - without public debate. The decision would give Barlow’s company control over more than half of Canada’s daily newspapers. Includes footage from various speeches and forums Barlow has taken part in, including “The Free trade debate”. She also shares her views on corporate rule and globalisation.
